meanings.definition: A wild dog native to Australia.
meanings.sent1: Dingoes are known for their distinctive howls in the Australian outback.
meanings.sent2: I saw a pack of dingoes roaming freely in the bush.
meanings.sent3: The dingoes decided to have a party in the desert, howling at the moon.
meanings.sent4: The dingoes' presence in the wilderness added a sense of mystery to the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the dingoes running across the red sand was truly mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: Look at those dingoes over there, they seem to be playing together.
meanings.sent2: The dingoes' footprints were visible in the soft soil.
meanings.sent3: The farmer chuckled as he watched the mischievous dingoes chase each other around the paddock.
meanings.sent4: The dingoes' howls echoed through the night, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The pack of dingoes moved swiftly through the grass, their presence felt by all nearby.
